subject: Psychology
title: Kahneman and Tversky
description: A quick, practical guide to Kahneman and Tversky.

hook.text: Two Israeli psychologists rewrote economics, won a Nobel Prize, and proved humans are predictably irrational.

buildup.text: Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky studied how people actually make decisions â€” not how they should.

discovery.text: They identified heuristics and biases: mental shortcuts that work often but fail in systematic, predictable ways.

twist.text: Prospect theory showed people fear losses more than they value gains â€” overturning rational choice economics.

climax.text: Their work launched behavioral economics and changed policy, medicine, law, and business forever.

punchline.text: They proved we're not rational. We're predictably irrational.

quiz.question: What did Kahneman and Tversky's prospect theory reveal?
options: People fear losses more than they value equivalent gains
People always make perfectly rational decisions
Gains and losses are valued equally by the brain
